InVision is a popular design tool used by UX/UI designers for creating interactive prototypes and collaborating with team members.
InVision allows designers to create clickable prototypes that simulate the user experience of a website or application.
InVision provides features like drag-and-drop functionality, real-time collaboration, and interactive animations to enhance the design process.
Designers can easily share their InVision prototypes with stakeholders for feedback and review.
InVision integrates with popular design tools like Sketch and Adobe XD, allowing for seamless workflow between design and prototyping.
Zeplin is a design collaboration tool that allows designers and developers to work together on projects.
It helps streamline the handoff process by providing a platform for designers to share design files with developers.
Designers can upload their designs to Zeplin, where developers can inspect and extract assets, measurements, and code snippets.
Zeplin supports various design file formats such as Sketch, Adobe XD, and Figma.
Developers can access design specifications, color codes, font styles, and export assets directly from Zeplin.
Marvel is a popular design tool used by UX/UI designers to create interactive prototypes.
It allows designers to create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes with ease.
Marvel offers a user-friendly interface that simplifies the design process.
Designers can collaborate in real-time using Marvel, making it a great tool for team projects.
Proto.io is a popular prototyping tool used for creating interactive prototypes for web and mobile applications.
It allows designers to create wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes without writing any code.
Proto.io offers a drag-and-drop interface, making it easy to design and prototype user interfaces.
Designers can simulate user interactions, transitions, and animations to create a realistic user experience.
Proto.io provides a variety of pre-built UI components and templates to speed up the design process.
Users can test their prototypes on different devices and share them with stakeholders for feedback.
Proto.io integrates with popular design tools like Sketch and Adobe XD for a seamless design workflow.
Designers can collaborate in real-time and gather feedback from team members using Proto.io's collaboration features.
Proto.io offers a range of interactive gestures and touch events to create realistic prototypes.
Users can preview their prototypes on actual devices using the Proto.io mobile app.
Proto.io allows designers to create responsive prototypes that adapt to different screen sizes.
Designers can create user flows and interactive prototypes to demonstrate the functionality of their designs.
Proto.io provides detailed analytics to track user interactions and gather insights for improving the design.
Users can export their prototypes in various formats, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for development purposes.
Proto.io offers a user-friendly interface with powerful features for designing and prototyping UX/UI experiences.
Flinto is a prototyping tool used for creating interactive prototypes for mobile and web applications.
Flinto allows designers to create animated transitions and micro-interactions to visualize the user experience.
Flinto offers a simple drag-and-drop interface for designing prototypes without the need for coding.
Flinto supports gesture-based interactions, making it easy to simulate touch gestures like swiping and tapping.
Flinto provides a preview feature that allows designers to test their prototypes on actual devices for a more realistic user experience.
Origami Studio is a prototyping tool created by Facebook for designing interactive prototypes for web and mobile applications.
It allows designers to create complex animations and interactions without writing code, making it a powerful tool for UX/UI designers.
Origami Studio provides a visual interface for designing user interfaces and interactions, enabling designers to quickly iterate on their designs.
Designers can create interactive prototypes by connecting different layers and elements in Origami Studio, simulating user interactions and animations.
Origami Studio offers a range of built-in components and interactions that designers can use to create realistic prototypes.
Designers can preview their prototypes in real-time on mobile devices using the Origami Live app, allowing for quick feedback and testing.
Origami Studio integrates seamlessly with other design tools and platforms, making it a versatile tool for UX/UI designers.
